availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Woodruff (Miller) (Franklin County, Kentucky, cigar maker)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, prisoner and cigar maker. Virginia native. Convicted of obtaining money under false pretenses in Louisville, Kentucky, on January 18, 1860. Prisoner in the Kentucky State Penitentiary in Frankfort, from December 1859 until his pardon on January 21, 1865. Cigar maker in Frankfort in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, District 1, p. 288.
_”The Confidence Men.” Louisville Daily Courier. (Louisville, KY.) December 17, 1859. (accessed via Newspapers.com)
_”Circuit Court- Criminal Term.” Courier-Journal. (Louisville, KY.) January 19, 1860. (accessed via Newspapers.com)
_”The Criminal Court.” Louisville Daily Courier. (Louisville, KY.) January 19, 1860. (accessed via Newspapers.com)
_ “Escaped Convict Arrested.” Louisville Daily Courier. (Louisville, KY.) November 26, 1860. (accessed via Newspapers.com)
